intro: Euphrasia oakesii var. oakesii, commonly known as Oakes' eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in partial shade and is often found in the understory of forests. Its scientific name honors the botanist John Oakes, who contributed to the study of North American flora.
